intro: Lilium leucanthum var. leucanthum, commonly known as the white lily, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features showy, white to pale pink flowers with a fragrant scent, typically blooming in late summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a single stem that can reach up to 1 meter in height. Its bulbs are adapted to survive harsh climates, and it thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. This variety is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and its historical significance in floral symbolism.
